org.apache.spark.rpc

Interface RpcEndpoint

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ThreadSafeRpcEndpoint

    public interface RpcEndpoint
    An end point for the RPC that defines what functions to trigger given a message.

    It is guaranteed that onStart, receive and onStop will be called in sequence.

    The life-cycle of an endpoint is:

    constructor -> onStart -> receive* -> onStop

    Note: receive can be called concurrently. If you want receive to be thread-safe, please use ThreadSafeRpcEndpoint

    If any error is thrown from one of RpcEndpoint methods except onError, onError will be invoked with the cause. If onError throws an error, RpcEnv will ignore it.

      Invoked when any exception is thrown during handling messages.

      • onStart

        void onStart()
        Invoked before RpcEndpoint starts to handle any message.

      • onStop

        void onStop()
        Invoked when RpcEndpoint is stopping. self will be null in this method and you cannot use it to send or ask messages.

      • receive

        scala.PartialFunction<Object,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> receive()
        Process messages from RpcEndpointRef.send or RpcCallContext.reply. If receiving a unmatched message, SparkException will be thrown and sent to onError.
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • receiveAndReply

        scala.PartialFunction<Object,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> receiveAndReply(RpcCallContext context)
        Process messages from RpcEndpointRef.ask. If receiving a unmatched message, SparkException will be thrown and sent to onError.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • rpcEnv

        org.apache.spark.rpc.RpcEnv rpcEnv()
        The RpcEnv that this RpcEndpoint is registered to.
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • self

        org.apache.spark.rpc.RpcEndpointRef self()
        The RpcEndpointRef of this RpcEndpoint. self will become valid when onStart is called. And self will become null when onStop is called.

        Note: Because before onStart, RpcEndpoint has not yet been registered and there is not valid RpcEndpointRef for it. So don't call self before onStart is called.

        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • stop

        void stop()
        A convenient method to stop RpcEndpoint.
